channel.title: VS2010 to compile for OSX and iPhone

http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/05/27/ballmer_wwdc/

item.title: VS2010 to compile for OSX and iPhone
item.dc:creator: @force force
item.description:
@force wrote:

http://www.airplaysdk.com/

Works with Visual Studio… Code in C++… Can build iPhone apps… Can download for FREE! (has a way to run a example sortof like apple does)

item.title: VS2010 to compile for OSX and iPhone
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“nade, post:17, topic:341582”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=437984.msg3219367#msg3219367 date=1275037211]

You can make Iphone apps in Eclipse and Java

How? The Objective-C plugin for eclipse is only for the mac version of eclipse…
[/quote]

http://www.programmersheaven.com/article/100736-Write+native+iPhone+applications+using+Eclipse+CDT/info.aspx

Nigga needs to google before replying.[/quote]

Nigga needs to try his sources before reply.

The IBM page that the article you linked to contains, returns a 404 error

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman

@Mopman wrote:

item.source: VS2010 to compile for OSX and iPhone

item.title: VS2010 to compile for OSX and iPhone
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:11, topic:341582”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=437984.msg3218845#msg3218845 date=1274993295]

The Register is right though; “Especially since both firms are well aware that the real enemy is one they both face: Google”
'sprobs why this is happening.

Makes sense. Before reading this article I didn’t realize that you have to pay $100/year to write your own application for your own iphone. What a rip off. Makes me ever more glad that I have an android phone, that not only can I write my own programs for free on, but you can also develop them in windows, linux, or mac.
[/quote]

Sure you have the freedom to write your own programs, but how often do you exercise that freedom for your phone?[/quote]
By jailbreaking it and uploading it to an external repo that apple has no rights over? :]

Read full topic

Makes me ever more glad that I have an android phone, that not only can I write my own programs for free on, but you can also develop them in windows, linux, or mac.[/quote]
